language

Interface Operator<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of data stored in Operands.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BinaryOperator

    public interface Operator<T>
    An Operator is capable of performing an operation on some number of Operands.
    Author:
    jddevaug, jcollard

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getNumberOfArguments()
      Returns the number of Operands that this Operator needs to perform its operation.
      Operand<T> performOperation()
      Performs this operation on values supplied via the setOperand(int, Operand) method and returns the resulting Operand.
      void setOperand(int position, Operand<T> operand)
      Sets the specified Operand.

    • Method Detail

      • getNumberOfArguments

        int getNumberOfArguments()
        Returns the number of Operands that this Operator needs to perform its operation.
        Returns:
        the number of Operands that this Operator needs to perform its operation.

      • performOperation

        Operand<T> performOperation()
        Performs this operation on values supplied via the setOperand(int, Operand) method and returns the resulting Operand.
        Returns:
        the result of applying this Operator to its Operands
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the required Operands were not set.

      • setOperand

        void setOperand(int position,
                Operand<T> operand)

        Sets the specified Operand.

        Note: Operands positions are indexed by 0 so the first Operand should be set with 0, the second with 1, third with 2, etc...

        Parameters:
        i - the position of the operand
        operand - the Operand to set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the position was previously set.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the operand provided is null.
